summary: Enables fast-leave for IGMP on specified VLAN.
synopsis: This command enables IGMP Snooping fast-leave admin mode for a specific VLAN, allowing hosts to leave multicast groups without affecting other hosts on the same layer 2 LAN interface. Fast-leave is supported for IGMPv2 hosts only.

summary: Globally enables/disables fast-leave auto-assignment.
synopsis: This command enables or disables the automatic assignment of fast-leave for all ports and LAGs. The operational state of fast-leave may override configured values depending on the RSTP status of each port.

summary: Forwards IGMP Join/Leave PDUs to all VLAN ports.
synopsis: This command allows the switch to forward IGMP Join/Leave PDUs received from hosts to all other ports within the specified VLAN, with default settings varying by VLAN.

summary: Sets the IGMP group membership interval time.
synopsis: This command sets the amount of time in seconds that a switch waits for a report from a particular group on an interface before deleting it from the entry, allowing for configuration at VLAN, interface or global levels.

summary: Enables IGMP IP header validation.
synopsis: This command enables validation of IGMP packet headers for important fields such as TTL, ToS, and Router Alert, ensuring compliance with IGMP standards.

summary: Enables IGMP Snooping on all interfaces.
synopsis: This command activates IGMP Snooping for all interfaces at once, but is only effective when routing and port-channel memberships are disabled on those interfaces.

summary: Sets the maximum response time for IGMP on interfaces or VLANs.
synopsis: This command sets the IGMP maximum response time on a particular interface or VLAN. It defines how long the switch waits after sending a query for a report. The value must be less than the IGMP query interval.

summary: Sets multicast router present expiration time.
synopsis: This command defines the time a switch waits for a query on an interface before removing it from the list of interfaces with multicast routers, with a range allowing for an infinite timeout.

summary: Configures the VLAN ID with multicast router mode enabled.
synopsis: This command specifies which VLAN should operate in multicast router mode, allowing it to handle multicast traffic appropriately.

summary: Configures interface as a multicast router interface.
synopsis: This command sets the specified interface or interface range as a multicast router interface, allowing it to process multicast traffic in all VLANs.

summary: Enables proxy IGMP queries.
synopsis: This command allows a non-querier switch to send out proxy IGMP queries, facilitating multicast support in networks where no active querier is detected; it can be applied globally or to specific interfaces or VLANs.

summary: Enables IGMP Snooping Querier with a specified IP address.
synopsis: This command enables the IGMP Snooping Querier function either globally or on a specific VLAN, allowing for the configuration of an IP address used as the source for periodic IGMP queries to solicit multicast memberships.

summary: Enables participation in IGMP querier election.
synopsis: This command allows the IGMP snooping querier to engage in the querier election process, determining whether to send periodic queries based on the presence of other queriers.

summary: Sets the IGMP querier query interval time.
synopsis: This command sets the IGMP querier query interval, specifying the period in seconds (1–1800) that the switch waits before sending another general query. Default is 60 seconds.

syntax: set igmp querier timer expiry seconds
summary: Sets the timer expiration period for IGMP querier state.
synopsis: This command adjusts the expiration period for the non-querier mode after detecting a multicast querier, with a configurable range of 60 to 300 seconds, ensuring timely response to network changes.

summary: Sets the IGMP version.
synopsis: This command selects the IGMP version (v1, v2, or v3) to be used for multicast operations on the device, affecting its compatibility with multicast routers and hosts.

summary: Suppresses IGMP reports on a VLAN.
synopsis: This command suppresses redundant IGMP responses from multiple clients for the same multicast group address, only allowing the first response to be forwarded to optimize network traffic.

summary: Enables IGMP snooping features on the device.
synopsis: The 'set igmp-plus' command configures IGMP snooping capabilities to optimize multicast traffic handling in the network, ensuring efficient delivery of multicast packets to the appropriate interfaces.

summary: Associates IGMP snooping with a specific VLAN.
synopsis: This command enables IGMP snooping for a designated VLAN, ensuring that multicast traffic is managed properly within that VLAN by preventing unnecessary flooding of multicast packets.

summary: Routes packets to interface null 0 to drop them.
synopsis: Specifies that matching packets should be directed to the null interface if no other matching criteria are met, effectively dropping those packets.

summary: Defines default next-hop IP addresses for packets without an active route.
synopsis: This command sets a list of default next-hop IP addresses that are used when there are no active routes available in the routing table, providing flexibility in managing traffic.

syntax: set ip mroute static-multicast group-ip-address vlan-list
summary: Configures a static multicast route for a group IP address on specified VLANs.
synopsis: This command allows you to set up a static multicast route by specifying a multicast group IP address and a list of VLANs that are enabled for routing. Ensure all VLANs are configured with IP addresses, and only one static route per group IP can be set.

summary: Specifies a next-hop IP address for IP routing.
synopsis: With this command, you indicate a specific next-hop IP address for routing purposes, which can aid in defining clearer routing protocols and behaviors in different scenarios.

summary: Sets the precedence value for IP packets.
synopsis: This command alters the precedence value of IP packets, allowing for prioritization of certain traffic types in an IP network to improve performance and reliability.

summary: Enables MLD Snooping on the specified VLAN.
synopsis: This command enables MLD Snooping either globally or on a specific interface or VLAN. It helps in selectively forwarding multicast packets based on MLD control packets.

summary: Excludes a specified interface from MLD routing.
synopsis: This command prevents the specified interface from participating in multicast routing, which can enhance network performance by limiting unnecessary multicast traffic.

summary: Enables MLD Snooping fast-leave mode.
synopsis: This command sets MLD Snooping fast-leave mode, allowing immediate removal of the interface from the forwarding table upon receiving an MLD done message. Use on VLANs with only one host connected to prevent dropping other active hosts.

summary: Sets the MLD Group Membership Interval time.
synopsis: This command configures the interval time for MLD group membership reports before the switch deletes the interface from the entry. The range is 2 to 3600 seconds, with a default of 260 seconds.

summary: Enables MLD Snooping on all interfaces.
synopsis: This command enables MLD Snooping on all interfaces. If an interface is configured for routing or a port-channel, MLD Snooping functionality is disabled for that interface.

summary: Sets the MLD maximum response time.
synopsis: This command specifies the maximum wait time after sending an MLD query without a received report. The permissible range is 1 to 65 seconds, with a default of 10 seconds.

summary: Sets the multicast router present expiration time.
synopsis: Configures the duration (in seconds) for which the switch should wait for a multicast query before removing an interface with multicast routers. Acceptable values range from 0 (infinite) to 3600.

summary: Sets the specified interface as the multicast router.
synopsis: Using this command makes a given interface the multicast router for the network, ensuring it can properly manage multicast traffic and group memberships.

summary: Adds a multicast router interface.
synopsis: This command configures a specific interface to handle multicast routing, thus making it a point for packet distribution for multicast streams.

summary: Enables the switch to send proxy queries using 0::0 as the source IP.
synopsis: This command allows a switch to send proxy queries through various command modes: Global Config for the entire switch, Interface Config for a specific interface, or VLAN Config for a specific VLAN. By default, this feature is enabled.

summary: Enables MLD Snooping Querier on the system or VLAN.
synopsis: This command activates MLD Snooping Querier functionality, allowing the switch to send periodic membership queries using a specified IP address as the source. If MLD Snooping is disabled on the VLAN where this is enabled, the querier functionality will also be disabled.

summary: Enables participation in the Querier Election process.
synopsis: This command allows the Snooping Querier to enter the election process to determine which switch will send periodic queries, based on the superiority of IP addresses.

summary: Sets the MLD querier query interval time.
synopsis: This command defines the waiting period in seconds (1-1800) before the querier sends another general multicast query, impacting how quickly membership information is updated.

summary: Sets the timer for MLD query expiry.
synopsis: This command sets how long a multicast group membership is considered valid before it is expiring, influencing how quickly the device will determine that a listener has left the group.

summary: Enables MLD snooping features on the device.
synopsis: The 'set mld-plus' command configures MLD snooping functionalities to manage multicast traffic effectively for IPv6 networks, enhancing multicast forwarding efficiency.

summary: Associates MLD snooping with a specific VLAN.
synopsis: This command enables MLD snooping for a specified VLAN, allowing precise management of multicast traffic for IPv6 in that VLAN, reducing unnecessary multicast packet distribution.

summary: Changes the prompt name.
synopsis: This command sets a new prompt name, which can be up to 64 alphanumeric characters long. It is executed in Privileged EXEC mode.

summary: Disables a specified slot.
synopsis: This command disables a specific hardware slot in a stack configuration, which can be useful for maintenance or troubleshooting.

summary: Enable power for specified slot(s) or all slots.
synopsis: This command configures the power mode for identified slot(s) to supply power, applicable when installing or removing cards.

summary: Transfers full CLI access among switch members.
synopsis: This command allows transferring full command line interface access to a different switch member, ensuring management capabilities stay with one active member.

summary: Enable a new sFlow poller instance on an interface.
synopsis: This command configures a poller for sFlow data collection on the specified interface or range of interfaces, utilizing a valid sFlow receiver index and defining the polling interval in seconds.

syntax: sflow receiver rcvr_idx {owner owner-string {timeout rcvr_timeout | notimeout} | maxdatagram size | ip ip | port port}
summary: Configures the sFlow collector parameters.
synopsis: This command sets parameters for the sFlow collector such as owner identity, receiver timeout, maximum datagram size, IP address, and destination port.

syntax: sflow receiver index owner owner-string notimeout
summary: Configures a receiver as a non-timeout entry, retaining its configuration in the running config.
synopsis: This command establishes an sFlow receiver that doesn't time out, ensuring it and associated samplers maintain their configurations in the running configuration after a reboot.

syntax: sflow receiver index owner owner-string timeout
summary: Configures a receiver as a timeout entry, retaining information about samplers and pollers.
synopsis: This command sets a specific timeout for an sFlow receiver, ensuring configurations persist across reboots while displaying sampler and poller details in the running configuration.

syntax: sflow sampler {rcvr-indx | rate sampling-rate | maxheadersize size}
summary: Configures a new sFlow sampler instance on an interface to collect flow samples.
synopsis: This command establishes an sFlow sampler to send flow sample data to the designated receiver, including parameters for receiver index, sampling rate, and maximum header size.

syntax: sflow source-interface {unit/slot/port | loopback loopback-id | tunnel tunnel-id | vlan vlan-id}
summary: Specifies the source interface for sFlow communications.
synopsis: This command is used to configure the physical or logical interface that acts as the source for sFlow client communications. If this interface is down, the client will revert to the default behavior, and without a specified interface, there will be no change in behavior.

summary: Displays the content of text-based configuration files from the CLI.
synopsis: This command allows users to view the contents of configuration files that are compressed in flash memory, decrypting them for clarity. It works with startup, backup, and factory-defaults configurations.

summary: Displays the Information Access Server (IAS) users.
synopsis: This command shows the list of IAS users configured on the switch, providing details such as usernames. It reveals users with configured access for authentication.

summary: Displays information about IP, IPv6, and MAC access control lists for a designated interface.
synopsis: This command provides detailed access control list insights for a specified interface and direction, including ACL types and identifiers, along with information specific to control-plane applications.

summary: Displays the access control lists associated with a specific VLAN.
synopsis: This command allows you to view access control lists that are applied to VLAN interfaces, helping you manage traffic permissions based on VLAN configurations.

summary: Displays the status of accounting notifications.
synopsis: This command provides information about the number of accounting notifications sent during EXEC sessions and command executions to help in diagnosing potential accounting issues.

summary: Displays the methods used for accounting.
synopsis: This command provides details on the accounting methods implemented on the device, which can be crucial for monitoring and auditing user access.

summary: Displays the applications installed on the switch.
synopsis: This command shows the applications that are installed on the switch along with their execution configurations, such as startup behavior and CPU/memory limits.

summary: Displays files in the application directory.
synopsis: This command shows all files present in the application directory of the switch file system, including file names, sizes, and the total directory size.

summary: Displays the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) cache of the switch.
synopsis: This command lists the ARP cache entries, providing details of the ARP mappings for IP addresses to MAC addresses, enabling troubleshooting and network verification.

summary: Displays configured ARP ACLs and their rules.
synopsis: This command is used to display the ARP access control lists (ACLs) along with their associated rules. Providing an ACL name restricts the output to that specific list.

summary: Displays a brief overview of the ARP table.
synopsis: This command provides a brief summary of the ARP table, outlining key details such as entry counts and timeouts. It is useful for quickly assessing ARP operational statistics.

summary: Displays the contents of the ARP table associated with the switch.
synopsis: This command displays the contents of the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) table associated with the IP address of the switch. It learns ARP entries associated with management interfaces only, excluding those linked to routing interfaces.

summary: Displays authentication history for a specified interface.
synopsis: This command provides information including the time of authentication, interface, MAC address, and the authentication method used for the specified interface.

summary: Displays authentication method information for all interfaces or a specific port.
synopsis: This command shows details such as the authentication restart timer, method order, method priority, number of authenticated clients, and current authentication status for each interface.

summary: Displays the authentication methods currently configured on the device.
synopsis: This command lists the authentication methods that are enabled on the network device, providing insight into how users are validated and which external or local databases are utilized.

summary: Displays authentication statistics for an interface.
synopsis: This command reveals the number of authentication attempts and failures associated with a specified interface, helping network administrators monitor and diagnose authentication issues.

summary: Displays the configured authorization method lists.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the current authorization method lists defined in the device, detailing both command and exec authorization methods associated with different access lines like console, telnet, and SSH.

summary: Displays the status of stack firmware synchronization.
synopsis: This command provides the configuration status of the stack firmware synchronization feature, showing whether it's enabled, if SNMP traps are sent, and if downgrades are allowed.

summary: Displays settings related to automatic DoS protection mechanisms.
synopsis: This command reveals how the device automatically protects against Denial of Service attacks, detailing configurations and current status.

summary: Displays the auto VoIP settings on specified interfaces.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information about the auto VoIP configuration, including VoIP VLAN ID, prioritization type, class value, and operational status of interfaces. It can be run for specific interfaces or all interfaces.

summary: Displays the VoIP OUI table information.
synopsis: This command retrieves the OUI (Organizationally Unique Identifier) entries related to VoIP devices, detailing their status and descriptions for easy identification of recognized VoIP manufacturers.

summary: Display the current status of the AutoInstall process.
synopsis: This command provides detailed output regarding the current status of AutoInstall, showing whether it is stopped or enabled and other relevant configurations.

summary: Displays Bonjour information and published services.
synopsis: This command is used in Privileged EXEC mode to view information regarding the Bonjour services currently published by the switch. It provides a list of service details.

summary: Displays BootP/DHCP Relay configuration information.
synopsis: This command shows the configuration and status of the BootP/DHCP Relay agent, including maximum hop count, minimum wait time, and whether relaying is enabled or disabled.

summary: Displays the current boot variables.
synopsis: This command shows the boot variables currently set on the device which can influence how it initializes and operates upon boot-up.

summary: Displays the status of the captive portal feature.
synopsis: This command reports the operational status of the captive portal feature, including its enabled state, reasons for being disabled, and details about its IP address configuration.

summary: Displays statistics for a specific captive portal client.
synopsis: This command provides detailed statistics for a given client identified by its MAC address, including total bytes received and transmitted, as well as the number of packets transmitted and received.

summary: Displays connection details for captive portal users.
synopsis: This command shows the status of connected clients, including their MAC address, IP address, connection protocol, verification mode, and the time since authorization. If a MAC address is provided, additional details related to that client are displayed.

summary: Displays the operational status of each captive portal configuration.
synopsis: This command shows information for a specific captive portal configuration identified by cp-id (ranging from 1 to 10), including the captive portal ID, name, operational status, disable reason, blocked status, authenticated users, and configured locales.

summary: Displays clients authenticated to a specific or all captive portal configurations.
synopsis: This command retrieves the status of clients authenticated to the captive portal. If a cp-id is specified, it shows stats for that particular configuration; otherwise, it displays details for all configured portals.

summary: Displays operational status for interfaces assigned to a captive portal.
synopsis: This command provides details for all interfaces assigned to a specific captive portal configuration, or for a specific interface if indicated. It shows information such as the interface description, operational status, disable reason, and number of authenticated users.

summary: Displays locales associated with a captive portal configuration.
synopsis: This command provides a list of all locales defined for a specific captive portal configuration using the cp-id. It shows locale codes and names for different languages.

summary: Displays detailed status for a specific captive portal configuration.
synopsis: This command reveals extensive information on the specified captive portal configuration identified by cp-id, including its operation mode, protocol mode, redirection settings, bandwidth limits, session timeout, and idle timeout values.

summary: Displays eligible interfaces or capabilities of a specific interface.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of interfaces capable of supporting captive portals, either listing all eligible interfaces or detailed capabilities for a specified interface.

summary: Displays client information authenticated on a specific interface.
synopsis: This command gives connection details for clients authenticated on a particular interface or all interfaces if no specific unit/slot/port is provided. It shows the client's MAC address, IP address, and the associated captive portal details.

summary: Displays interface to configuration assignments for captive portals.
synopsis: This command displays the interface to configuration assignments for all captive portal configurations or a specific configuration identified by cp-id, which ranges from 1-10.

summary: Reports the status of all captive portal instances.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of all captive portal instances, including additional HTTP and HTTPS port configurations, authentication timeout settings, and the number of supported/local users in the system.

summary: Displays enabled SNMP traps for the captive portal.
synopsis: This command shows which SNMP traps are currently enabled for the captive portal feature, detailing traps related to client authentication failures, successful connections, database issues, and disconnections.

summary: Displays details about captive portal users from the local database.
synopsis: This command shows configured users in the captive portal local user database. The optional user-id filters the details for a specific user. Including the group keyword, along with an optional group-id, organizes the output by user groups.

summary: Displays captured packets saved in RAM.
synopsis: This command reveals the packets captured during a session saved to RAM, limiting to a maximum of 128 packets of 128 bytes each. It does not retain data after a reboot.

summary: Displays information about the checkpoint service operation.
synopsis: This command provides details including the number of checkpoint messages, bytes transmitted, the time since the counters were cleared, and the average message rate, which aids in monitoring the performance of the checkpointing process.

summary: Displays configuration information for the specified class.
synopsis: This command shows configuration details for a specified DiffServ class. If 'class-name' is not provided, all defined classes are listed. Displays various properties including class type, Layer 3 protocol, and match criteria.

summary: Displays the current 802.1p priority mapping to internal traffic classes.
synopsis: This command shows the mapping of Dot1p (802.1p) user priority values to traffic classes for a specific interface or globally, allowing users to verify how priorities are assigned.

summary: Displays the current IP DSCP mapping to internal traffic classes.
synopsis: The command shows the mapping of IP DSCP values to traffic classes based on global configuration settings, helping administrators assess how different traffic types are classified.

summary: Displays the current trust mode setting for a specific interface.
synopsis: This command reveals the trust mode of a specified interface or the global setting, indicating how the device treats packets based on their originating traffic classification.

summary: Displays the configured prelogin CLI banner.
synopsis: This command retrieves and displays any prelogin CLI banner text that appears before the login prompt, which is useful for showing messages or important information to users before they log in.

summary: Displays the system's current time and date.
synopsis: This command retrieves and shows the current time and date from the system clock, useful for confirming the accuracy of system time.

summary: Displays detailed system time, including time zone and summer time configuration.
synopsis: This command provides comprehensive information about the current system time, along with additional details regarding time zone settings and whether summer time is enabled.

summary: Displays the cloud managed configuration parameters.
synopsis: This command shows the cloud managed configuration parameters. If a parameter is not configured, it is displayed as a series of dashes (-----). It provides information such as administrative mode, proxy IP address and port, user name and password encryption, and server URL.

summary: Summarizes interfaces configured with dampening.
synopsis: This command summarizes the number of interfaces configured with dampening and the number of interfaces currently suppressed. It displays the interfaces' configuration status and helps in monitoring dampening effects.

summary: Displays enabled packet tracing configurations.
synopsis: This command shows the current status of all debugging options that are activated on the device, allowing for quick verification of tracing settings.

summary: Displays the vendor ID options for DHCP clients.
synopsis: This command reveals the configured vendor ID options for DHCP clients which can help ensure that devices are recognized correctly during IP assignment.

summary: Displays L2 relay agent options for specific VLANs.
synopsis: This command shows the DHCP Layer 2 relay configurations for agent options assigned to VLANs, critical for ensuring proper DHCP relay functionality.

summary: Displays all settings for DHCP Layer 2 relay.
synopsis: This command shows comprehensive settings and statuses of the Layer 2 DHCP relay features configured on the device, facilitating effective relay management.

summary: Displays circuit ID settings for DHCP L2 relay per VLAN.
synopsis: This command provides information on circuit ID options applied to the Layer 2 DHCP relay specified for VLANs, which is crucial for identifying relay paths.

summary: Displays DHCP L2 relay configuration specific to interfaces.
synopsis: This command shows the DHCP L2 Relay configuration settings applied to a specified interface or all interfaces, indicating the state of relay functionalities.

syntax: show dhcp l2relay remote-id vlan vlan-list
summary: Displays DHCP Remote-id VLAN configuration.
synopsis: This command reveals the configuration settings for the DHCP Remote-ID in specified VLANs, allowing monitoring of configurations related to remote identification.

syntax: show dhcp l2relay stats interface {all | unit/slot/port}
summary: Displays statistics for DHCP L2 Relay configured interfaces.
synopsis: This command retrieves statistics regarding the DHCP L2 Relay operations on specified interfaces, showing message counts for trusted/untrusted servers and clients.

summary: Displays subscription details for DHCP L2 relay interface.
synopsis: This command provides insights into subscription details of the DHCP Layer 2 relay interface, necessary for tracking relay functionalities.

summary: Displays DHCP VLAN configuration.
synopsis: This command shows the configuration of DHCP for specified VLANs, defined by a list of VLAN IDs in the range of 1–4093, using a dash for ranges or a comma for separating IDs. Spaces and zeros are not permitted.

summary: Displays currently leased IPv4 addresses from a DHCP server.
synopsis: This command shows a list of all IPv4 addresses currently leased from a DHCP server for specified or all in-band interfaces, detailing their status, lease server information, and renewal times. It operates in privileged EXEC mode.

summary: Displays the general status of DiffServ.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the DiffServ status, including the current administrative mode and the size of several tables related to classes, policies, and services. It helps in monitoring and validating the DiffServ configuration.

summary: Displays policy service information for a specified interface and direction.
synopsis: This command details the DiffServ administrative mode and any attached policies on the specified interface. It includes operational status and policy details specific to that direction.

summary: Displays all interfaces with an attached DiffServ policy.
synopsis: This command lists all interfaces currently configured with attached DiffServ policies, showing the operational status and policy names applicable in the indicated direction. The inbound direction parameter is optional.

summary: Displays the configured domain name on the switch.
synopsis: This command retrieves and shows the domain name settings configured on the switch, which can be useful for DNS-related configurations and verifications.

summary: Displays Denial of Service configuration information.
synopsis: This command outputs the current configuration settings for Denial of Service protections, providing insight into active filters and states.

summary: Displays interfaces enabled for Double VLAN Tunneling.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of all interfaces configured for Double VLAN Tunneling, with optional parameters for specific interface details, aiding in network management.

syntax: #show dot1x [{summary {unit/slot/port | all} | detail unit/slot/port | statistics unit/slot/port}]
summary: Displays dot1x configuration and statistics for specific ports or globally.
synopsis: This command provides a summary of global dot1x settings, detailed configurations, or statistics based on the specified parameters, allowing for monitoring and management of dot1x authentication.

summary: Displays 802.1X authentication events and information.
synopsis: This command provides a history of dot1x authentication events, allowing for filtering by successful or failed authentications. Useful for troubleshooting and monitoring authentication status on specified interfaces or all interfaces.

summary: Displays 802.1X client information.
synopsis: This command lists information about authenticated 802.1X clients, including MAC addresses, associated interfaces, session details, and VLAN assignments, providing insights into client connectivity and authentication status.

summary: Displays statistics related to 802.1X authentication.
synopsis: This command provides relevant statistics on 802.1X authentication processes, essential for understanding the performance of network access controls.

summary: Displays locally configured 802.1X users.
synopsis: This command shows the users that are locally configured to access the specified port, helping administrators manage port access for authenticated users.

summary: Displays interfaces enabled for Double VLAN Tunneling.
synopsis: This command shows the current status and configuration details for Double VLAN Tunneling across specified interfaces, which is crucial for traffic management in a multi-VLAN environment.

summary: Displays environmental data including temperature and power supply status.
synopsis: This command provides temperature readings and operational status of power supplies and fans in the switch chassis, ensuring that the system operates within designated thermal limits.

summary: Displays the current status of error-disable recovery settings.
synopsis: This command shows the configuration and status of the interfaces that are set to automatically recover from an error-disabled state due to specific causes, facilitating network resilience.

summary: Displays the event log containing error messages from the system.
synopsis: This command displays the event log, which contains error messages from the system. The event log retains information across system resets. The unit parameter specifies the switch identifier for the log.

summary: Displays the configuration parameters for generating a core dump file.
synopsis: This command lists the current settings related to core dump generation, including file naming conventions, active protocols, and configured NFS or TFTP parameters, helping to ensure proper dump functionality.

summary: Displays diagnostic information of the SFP transceivers.
synopsis: This command provides details on various parameters like temperature, voltage, current, and optical power of SFP modules, assisting in assessing the operational status of fiber connections and diagnosing potential issues.

summary: Displays raw diagnostic data of the SFP.
synopsis: This command retrieves and displays the raw diagnostic data from the specified fiber port's SFP, which can be useful for in-depth analysis and troubleshooting of the transceiver's performance.

summary: Displays the EEPROM data of the SFP.
synopsis: This command retrieves Electrically Erasable Programmable Read-Only Memory (EEPROM) contents for the specified SFP, including vendor name, serial number, and part number, essential for inventory and troubleshooting purposes.

summary: Displays SFP vendor information and link lengths.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information about the SFP installed in the specified port, including vendor name, serial number, part number, and supported link lengths, useful for ensuring compatibility and performance.

summary: Displays flow control status and settings.
synopsis: Use this command to view IEEE 802.3 flow control settings and operational status for a specific interface or all interfaces. It shows Tx and Rx pause counts and indicates priority flow control status.

summary: Displays aging time for forwarding database entries.
synopsis: This command provides the aging time settings for entries in the forwarding database, which is critical for understanding how quickly entries expire.

summary: Displays GARP information.
synopsis: This command retrieves and displays information related to the Generic Address Resolution Protocol (GARP), which aids in IP address configuration across the network.

summary: Displays GMRP configuration.
synopsis: This command retrieves the configuration settings for the Group Membership Registration Protocol (GMRP), which manages group multicast memberships.

summary: Displays the green-mode configuration and operational status.
synopsis: This command is executed in Privileged EXEC mode to show the green-mode configuration and operational status across all ports or a specified port. The output includes metrics such as energy savings, power consumption, and the supported green Ethernet features for the specified unit.

summary: Displays interface green-mode EEE LPI history.
synopsis: This command shows the historical data regarding EEE LPI statistics for a specified interface, including the sampling interval, total samples kept, percentage of time spent in LPI mode, and individual sample time data.

summary: Displays GARP information for one or all interfaces.
synopsis: This command retrieves and shows the Generic Attributes Registration Protocol (GARP) configuration details for specified interfaces or all interfaces in the system.

summary: Displays inventory information for the switch.
synopsis: This command displays inventory information for the switch. Note that this command will be deprecated in future releases, with its functionality being included in the show version command.

summary: Displays hostname entries and settings.
synopsis: This command outputs information about the configured hostname-to-address mappings, default domain names, and the current DNS client configuration.

summary: Displays IGMP snooping configurations and status.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the IGMP snooping settings and the current IGMP snooping table entries, which is important for verifying multicast group memberships.

summary: Displays fast leave configuration for IGMP snooping.
synopsis: This command retrieves the settings related to fast leave functionalities within IGMP snooping, enabling quicker removal of multicast group memberships.

syntax: show igmpsnooping group [vlan-id | interface (unit/slot/port) | lag lag-id]
summary: Displays IGMP Snooping group information.
synopsis: This command displays the source and group IP addresses along with corresponding MAC addresses detected through IGMP Snooping across VLANs, interfaces, or LAGs.

summary: Displays multicast router information for a specified interface.
synopsis: This command provides details on multicast router status for the specified interface, indicating whether the multicast router is statically enabled.

summary: Displays information about multicast router configuration on a specified VLAN.
synopsis: This command displays information about statically configured multicast router ports for a particular VLAN on the specified unit, slot, and port, facilitating multicast route management.

summary: Displays the settings for the IGMP proxy querier.
synopsis: This command provides details on the configurations of the IGMP proxy querier, which is essential for managing multicast traffic in the network.

summary: Displays IGMP Snooping Querier information.
synopsis: This command shows whether IGMP Snooping Querier is active, as well as details such as Admin Mode, Querier Address, Query Interval, and Querier Timeout. If 'detail' is used, it shows global information and details for all Querier-enabled VLANs.

summary: Displays Source Specific Multicast (SSM) information.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information regarding Source Specific Multicasting (SSM), including entries, groups, or statistics, essential for analyzing multicast traffic sourced from defined addresses.

summary: Displays traffic statistics for a specific interface.
synopsis: This command offers a summary of statistics for network traffic concerning packet reception, transmission, errors, and collisions, either for a specified interface or aggregated for CPU traffic.

summary: Displays the status and parameters of dampened interfaces.
synopsis: This command displays the status and configured parameters of interfaces that are configured with IP event dampening. It includes details such as flap counts, accumulated penalties, and whether the interface is suppressed, along with configurable thresholds.

summary: Display interface debounce settings.
synopsis: This command provides information about the debounce settings on a network interface, which help in stabilizing the interface state by filtering transient link state changes.

summary: Displays detailed statistics for specified interfaces.
synopsis: This command displays detailed statistics for a specific interface or all CPU traffic based on the argument. It includes counts of packets received and transmitted at various lengths, as well as error statistics, helping in evaluating Ethernet utilization.

summary: Displays private VLAN mapping information for switch interfaces.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information about private VLAN associations and mappings for host and promiscuous ports on specified switch interfaces, allowing network administrators to manage VLAN configurations effectively.

summary: Displays configuration information about a specified LAG interface.
synopsis: Use this command to retrieve statistics on packets transmitted and received on a Link Aggregation Group (LAG) interface, including error counts and packet discards, which helps in monitoring and troubleshooting network performance.

summary: Displays information about configured loopback interfaces.
synopsis: This command provides details about the loopback interfaces, displaying relevant information like IP address and status. If a loopback ID is specified, specific details for that loopback are shown.

summary: Displays PFC information for all interfaces or a specified interface.
synopsis: If an interface is specified, it shows the PFC information for that interface, otherwise, it provides details for all interfaces including operational status, configured priorities, and received/transmitted PFC frames. This command is executed in Privileged EXEC mode.

summary: Displays parameters related to the tunnel interface.
synopsis: This command outputs details of the tunnel interface including tunnel mode, source and destination addresses. If a tunnel ID is specified, it shows information specific to that tunnel; otherwise, it lists all configured tunnels.

summary: Displays the class-of-service queue configuration for a specified interface.
synopsis: The command provides information about class-of-service queue settings for a specified interface, including queue management types, shaping rates, and bandwidth guarantees.

summary: Displays hardware profile for ports supporting expandable features.
synopsis: This command displays the hardware profile information for ports that support the expandable port feature, including the status of 40G and corresponding 10G ports. You can specify an interface as an option. It is executed in Privileged EXEC mode.

summary: Displays interface status and capabilities.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information on interfaces, including their description, link state, speed, and autonegotiation capabilities. It outputs physical interfaces, LAG interfaces, and VLAN routing interfaces, and shows the configured name with a maximum length of 64 characters.

summary: Displays the interfaces that are in error-disabled state.
synopsis: This command provides information about interfaces that are error-disabled, including the reason for each interface being disabled and the remaining time before auto recovery takes place.

summary: Displays switch port status and VLAN membership.
synopsis: This command provides details of switch port status across all interfaces or for a specified interface/mode. It shows VLAN membership modes, PVIDs, and tagging information essential for managing VLAN configurations.

summary: Displays Auto-Trunk information for interfaces.
synopsis: This command shows information for all interfaces where the Auto-Trunk feature is enabled or for a specific interface if specified. It displays details like PVID and allowed VLANs.

summary: Views summary information about all configured IP ACLs.
synopsis: This command displays summary information regarding all IP ACLs configured on the switch, including committed rate, burst size, and packets matching ACL rules. Detailed info for a specific ACL can be viewed by specifying its number or name.

summary: Displays the status of the last detected address conflict.
synopsis: This command shows if an IP address conflict was detected, including details such as the last conflicting IP address, the MAC address of the conflicting host, and the time since the conflict was detected.

summary: Display the DAI global configuration and VLAN-specific configurations.
synopsis: Outputs the global settings for Dynamic ARP Inspection and configurations for specific VLANs, including state of MAC/IP validations and ACL details.

summary: Displays the DAI configuration on all enabled interfaces.
synopsis: This command shows the configuration details for Dynamic ARP Inspection on all interfaces that are enabled for DAI. It indicates the trust state, rate limit, and burst interval for each interface.

syntax: show ip arp inspection statistics [vlan vlan-list]
summary: Displays statistics for ARP packets processed by Dynamic ARP Inspection.
synopsis: This command shows forwarded and dropped ARP packets for specified VLANs or all DAI-enabled VLANs. You can view a summary or detailed statistics including counts for forwarded, dropped, DHCP, and ACL drops.

summary: Displays all summary information of the IP.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of IP configurations, including the computed TTL, routing mode, maximum next hops, and ICMP rate limits, along with whether ICMP Echo replies and redirects are enabled.

summary: Show DHCP bindings.
synopsis: Displays current DHCP bindings and corresponding lease times, critical for managing IP address assignments in the network.

summary: Displays address conflicts logged by the DHCP Server.
synopsis: This command lists IP address conflicts recorded by the DHCP server, allowing identification and troubleshooting of overlapping IP assignments. If no IP address is specified, all conflicting addresses are displayed.

summary: Displays the global DHCP configuration.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the global DHCP settings, including service status and conflict logging status.

syntax: show ip dhcp pool configuration {name | all}
summary: Displays DHCP pool configuration details.
synopsis: This command shows pool configuration, including pool name, type, lease time, DNS servers, and default routers. If 'all' is specified, configuration for all existing pools is displayed.

summary: Displays DHCP server statistics.
synopsis: This command shows various statistics related to DHCP server operations, including the number of automatic bindings, expired leases, and messages received or sent, providing insights into the DHCP service's status.

summary: Displays DHCP Snooping global and per port configurations.
synopsis: This command shows the global configurations for DHCP Snooping and displays details such as trusted ports and logging options for invalid packets on specified interfaces.

syntax: show ip dhcp snooping binding [static | dynamic] [interface unit/slot/port] [vlan-id]
summary: Displays DHCP Snooping binding entries.
synopsis: This command presents the binding entries in the DHCP Snooping database, with options to filter by static or dynamic entries, specific interfaces, or VLANs.

summary: Displays the DHCP Snooping configuration related to database persistency.
synopsis: This command provides information about the settings related to the DHCP Snooping database, such as agent URL and write delay, indicating how persistent the database is.

summary: Shows DHCP Snooping status of interfaces.
synopsis: This command lists the status of each interface regarding DHCP Snooping, including trust states and rate limits for DHCP messages.

summary: Lists statistics for DHCP Snooping security violations.
synopsis: This command provides statistics on DHCP Snooping violations on untrusted ports, displaying counts of MAC Verify failures, client-interface mismatches, and received DHCP server messages.

summary: Displays system-wide information for DVMRP.
synopsis: This command provides insights into the DVMRP configuration, indicating if DVMRP is enabled, its version, the number of routes, and their current operational state.

syntax: show ip dvmrp interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id}
summary: Displays DVMRP interface information.
synopsis: This command provides information about the DVMRP operational state and metrics for specified interfaces or VLANs, showing details like the interface mode and current statistics.

summary: Displays neighbor information for DVMRP.
synopsis: This command provides details about DVMRP neighbors including their operational state, learned time, and capabilities, aiding in network topology visualization.

summary: Displays next hop information for multicast routing.
synopsis: This command shows the next hop information on outgoing interfaces for routing multicast datagrams, providing details about the sources, masks, and respective next hop interfaces.

summary: Displays upstream prune information for the router.
synopsis: This command lists the router’s upstream prune information, specifying which multicast address has been pruned and the corresponding source address, mask, and expiry time.

summary: Displays multicast routing information for DVMRP.
synopsis: This command provides multicast routing information, including source addresses, masks, upstream neighbors, interfaces, and metrics, along with the expiry and up time.

summary: Displays statistics for processed and relayed UDP packets.
synopsis: This command outputs detailed counts of DHCP and UDP packet messages received and relayed by the system, helping in troubleshooting and performance monitoring for the IP helper functionality.

summary: Displays the IP helper address configuration.
synopsis: This command shows the configuration of IP helper addresses. It allows specifying the interface or VLAN ID for detailed examination of relay settings and can help manage traffic routing behavior.

summary: Displays the HTTP settings for the switch.
synopsis: This command shows the current configuration for HTTP including settings like HTTP mode (secure and unsecure), port number, maximum allowable HTTP sessions, and session timeouts.

summary: Displays system-wide IGMP information.
synopsis: This command outputs the system-wide IGMP information, including IGMP Admin Mode, interface status, and Protocol State, providing a summary of IGMP configurations across the system.

syntax: show ip igmp groups {unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id} [detail]
summary: Displays registered multicast groups.
synopsis: This command displays the registered multicast groups on the specified interface. By using the detail keyword, it provides in-depth information on multicast groups, including IP addresses, last membership report sources, and querier status.

syntax: show ip igmp interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id}
summary: Displays IGMP information for the specified interface.
synopsis: This command provides key details about IGMP configuration for an interface, showing the IGMP administrative status, operational status, version, and other relevant parameters.

syntax: show ip igmp interface membership multiipaddr [detail]
summary: Displays the list of interfaces registered in the multicast group.
synopsis: Shows the interfaces that are part of a specified multicast group by indicating their compatibility mode and source filter mode. If the detail option is used, additional information such as source hosts and expiry time is provided.

syntax: show ip igmp interface stats [unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id]
summary: Displays IGMP statistical information for the interface.
synopsis: This command shows detailed statistics of the IGMP state on a specified interface, including the querier status, IP address, join counts, and version mismatches, thus assisting in monitoring IGMP behavior.

summary: Displays a summary of the host interface status parameters.
synopsis: This command displays status parameters for IGMP Proxy, including interface index, admin mode, operational mode, IGMP version, number of multicast groups, unsolicited report interval, querier IP address, and timeout intervals for older IGMP queriers.

summary: Displays IGMP Proxy group information.
synopsis: This command shows the current IGMP Proxy multicast groups' details including group address, last reporter, up time, member state, filter mode, and the number of sources attached to the multicast groups.

summary: Displays complete information about multicast groups that IGMP Proxy reported.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information for each multicast group reported by IGMP Proxy, including interface index, group address, last reporter, up time, member state, filter mode, sources, and group source list.

summary: Displays a detailed list of the host interface status parameters.
synopsis: This command provides information on IGMP Proxy interface status, including IGMP version, query counts, report statistics, and the interface index. It's crucial for troubleshooting IGMP Proxy functionality.

syntax: show ip interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id | loopback number}
summary: Displays information about the IP interface.
synopsis: This command presents detailed information about the specified IP interface, including routing status, IP addresses, MTU size, link speed, and other encapsulation details. It can be issued in both privileged EXEC and user EXEC modes.

summary: Displays summary information about IP configuration for all router ports.
synopsis: This command presents a concise overview of IP configuration settings, including interface states, assigned IP addresses and masks, and the method of address assignment (DHCP or manual).

syntax: show ip irdp {unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id | all}
summary: Displays information about router discovery on interfaces.
synopsis: This command allows you to view router discovery information for either all interfaces or a specific one, including the maximum and minimum advertisement intervals, hold time, and preference.

summary: Displays the configured IP ECMP load balancing mode.
synopsis: This command reveals the current state of IP load-sharing configurations, allowing for a quick assessment of traffic distribution strategies across the network.

summary: Displays configuration settings of the management interface.
synopsis: This command provides details on the configuration of the switch's management interface, including IP address, subnet mask, default gateway, and MAC address types, which are critical for in-band management.

summary: Displays system-wide multicast information.
synopsis: This command provides information regarding the multicast settings and statistics of the system, including the administrative status, protocol state, table size, and entries in the multicast forwarding cache in Privileged EXEC or User EXEC mode.

summary: Displays all configured administrative scoped multicast boundaries.
synopsis: This command outputs the details of all multicast boundaries configured on the system, showing group IP addresses and their corresponding masks in Privileged EXEC or User EXEC mode.

syntax: show ip mcast interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id}
summary: Displays multicast information for a specified interface.
synopsis: This command shows the multicast settings and status for a given routing interface or VLAN, providing detailed information including TTL and other multicast configurations.

summary: Displays multicast route entries in the multicast forwarding database.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the multicast forwarding database, including operational modes (IPv4 and IPv6), entry counts, current protocols in use, and traffic statistics for multicast packets.

summary: Displays a summary or details of the multicast table.
synopsis: Depending on the parameters used, this command reveals either a brief overview or comprehensive details on multicast routes, including source IP, group IP, and various flags.

syntax: show ip mroute group groupipaddr {detail | summary}
summary: Displays multicast route settings for a specified group IP address.
synopsis: This command gives detailed configurations for multicast routes related to a specified group IP address, including flags, interfaces, and timers.

syntax: show ip mroute source sourceipaddr {summary | groupipaddr}
summary: Displays multicast configuration settings for a specific source IP or source/group pair.
synopsis: This command reveals details such as flags, timer settings, incoming and outgoing interfaces, RPF neighboring routers, and expiration times of all entries in the multicast route table related to the specified source IP address or a combination of source and group IP addresses.

summary: Displays all static multicast routes or routes for a specific source IP.
synopsis: This command can be used to view all static routes configured in the static multicast table or to retrieve the static route associated with a specific source IP address.

summary: Displays the static multicast routing table entries.
synopsis: This command provides a view of the current multicast routing table, revealing all static entries that have been set for multicast traffic management, critical for optimizing multicast delivery.

summary: Displays OSPF router configuration and link-state database information.
synopsis: This command provides comprehensive details about the OSPF configuration including Router ID, administrative mode, external LSDB limits, SPF delay and hold times, and other OSPF parameters.

summary: Displays internal OSPF routing table entries to Area Border Routers (ABR).
synopsis: This command provides information about routes leading to Area Border Routers, including types, costs, and next hop details, which are essential for understanding OSPF routing dynamics.

summary: Displays information about a specific OSPF area.
synopsis: This command reveals detailed statistics of the specified OSPF area, including the area ID, SPF runs, link-state advertisements, and routing capabilities, helping to monitor area-specific OSPF configurations.

summary: Displays internal OSPF routing table entries to Autonomous System Boundary Routers (ASBR).
synopsis: This command provides insights into routes directed towards Autonomous System Boundary Routers, showing route types, costs, and next hops, which is vital for OSPF operational clarity.

syntax: show ip ospf [[area-id] database [{database-summary | [{asbr-summary | external | network | nssa-external | opaque-area | opaque-as | opaque-link | router | summary}] [lsid] [{adv-router [ipaddr] | self-originate}]}]]
summary: Displays information about the OSPF link state database.
synopsis: This command shows LSA headers for all OSPF areas or a specific area if specified, allowing for an overview of the link-state database’s contents, crucial for diagnosing OSPF behavior.

summary: Displays the number of each type of LSA in the OSPF database.
synopsis: This command provides the total number of each type of Link State Advertisement (LSA) for each OSPF area and overall for the router. It includes counts for router, network, summary, ASBR, and Type-7 external LSAs, helping to understand the OSPF domain status.

syntax: show ip ospf interface {unit/slot/port | vlan <vlan-id> | loopback <loopback-id>}
summary: Displays OSPF interface information including IP address, subnet mask, and OSPF states.
synopsis: This command provides details on OSPF configuration including any secondary IPs, OSPF administration status, intervals, and metrics for surrounding interfaces.

summary: Displays brief information for OSPF-enabled interfaces.
synopsis: This command summarizes key configurations and states of all OSPF interfaces on the router, including whether OSPF is enabled, priority, cost, and various intervals, enabling quick assessments of OSPF interface status.

summary: Displays statistics for OSPF-enabled interfaces.
synopsis: This command presents various statistics related to OSPF interfaces, useful for monitoring OSPF performance.

summary: Displays the number of self-originated LSAs within each LSA group.
synopsis: This command provides insights into the number of LSAs the router is currently originating as well as the average LSAs per group, based on the defined pacing limits. It helps in monitoring OSPF LSA distribution efficiency.

syntax: show ip ospf neighbor [interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id}] [ip-address]
summary: Displays information about OSPF neighbors.
synopsis: This command shows OSPF neighbor details; if no IP address is provided, a summary table for all neighbors is displayed. Specifying an interface narrows down results. Detailed metrics include Router ID, priority, IP address, state, and additional parameters relevant to the neighbor relationship.

summary: Displays OSPF area range information.
synopsis: This command reveals the set of configured OSPFv2 area ranges for a specified area, detailing summary prefixes, subnet masks, types, actions (advertise/suppress), costs, and current active status.

summary: Displays OSPF routing table computation times and performance metrics.
synopsis: The 'show ip ospf statistics' command displays OSPF routing table computation times, including intra, inter, and external routes, RIB update times, and reasons for SPF execution, showcasing performance metrics in milliseconds and time intervals.

summary: Displays the OSPF stub table information.
synopsis: The 'show ip ospf stub table' command shows the OSPF stub table details, including area ID, type of service, metric value, and controls for importing summary LSAs into stub areas, applicable when OSPF is initialized on the switch.

summary: Displays OSPFv2 packet and LSA statistics.
synopsis: The 'show ip ospf traffic' command provides OSPFv2 packet and LSA statistics, counting packets and LSAs since the last clear, including retransmission details and message queue statistics.

syntax: show ip ospf virtual-link area-id neighbor
summary: Displays OSPF Virtual Interface information for a specific area and neighbor.
synopsis: The 'show ip ospf virtual-link' command shows OSPF Virtual Interface details for a specified area and neighbor, detailing hello and dead intervals, interface transmit delay, and authentication type.

summary: Displays brief OSPF Virtual Interface information for all areas.
synopsis: The 'show ip ospf virtual-link brief' command provides a summary of OSPF Virtual Interface information, including areas, neighbors, hello and dead intervals, and retransmit intervals for all configured areas.

summary: Displays system-wide information for PIM-DM or PIM-SM.
synopsis: This command shows the operational status of PIM interfaces, including whether PIM is enabled or disabled, and the current mode being used (either dense or sparse), along with specific interface details.

summary: Displays the bootstrap router (BSR) information.
synopsis: This command reveals details about the bootstrap router in use, including its IP address, priority settings, and hash mask length, aiding in understanding the BSR's configuration in the PIM environment.

syntax: show ip pim interface [unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id]
summary: Displays PIM interface status parameters.
synopsis: This command shows the PIM interface status parameters for specified interfaces, or all PIM-enabled interfaces if none specified, detailing mode, hello interval, join prune interval, DR priority, and neighbor count.

syntax: show ip pim neighbor [unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id]
summary: Displays PIM neighbors discovered by PIMv2 Hello messages.
synopsis: This command lists the PIM neighbors and their statuses, including IP addresses, uptime, expiry times, and designated router priorities. It helps in assessing the connectivity and status of PIM configurations.

syntax: show ip pim rp mapping [rp-address | candidate | static]
summary: Displays the mapping for PIM groups to active Rendezvous points (RP).
synopsis: This command shows the mapping of multicast groups to their respective RPs, including options to filter by specific RP addresses or types of mapping (candidate or static).

summary: Displays the rendezvous point (RP) selected for a specified group address.
synopsis: This command returns the IP address of the RP associated with the given multicast group. It indicates whether the RP was selected through BSR or is statically configured.

summary: Displays the configured source specific IP multicast addresses.
synopsis: This command lists the source-specific multicast (SSM) group addresses configured in the system, including their corresponding prefix lengths. If no ranges are configured, a message is displayed indicating so.

summary: Displays statistics for PIM (Protocol Independent Multicast) control packets per interface.
synopsis: This command provides a summary of received and transmitted PIM packets on interfaces, including Hello messages, Register messages, and Join/Prune messages. It's applicable when PIM sparse mode is enabled.

summary: Displays the route map associated with each interface.
synopsis: This command provides a listing of all route maps that are applied to each network interface, giving insight into the routing policies in effect.

summary: Lists configuration and status for each unicast routing protocol that is running.
synopsis: This command provides details about routing protocols such as OSPF and RIP, including their administrative modes, maximum path counts, distance metrics, and associated networks, which helps in understanding the routing setup.

summary: Displays information relevant to the RIP router.
synopsis: This command provides detailed information regarding the operations and settings of the RIP router, such as enabled modes and status of split horizon, auto summarization, and host route acceptance.

syntax: show ip rip interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id}
summary: Displays information related to a specific RIP interface.
synopsis: This command shows detailed configuration and status information for a specified RIP interface, including IP addressing, RIP version utilization, administrative mode, link state, and any authentication types configured.

summary: Displays general information for each RIP interface.
synopsis: This command presents a summarized view of each RIP interface's configuration and status, including IP addresses, version details, RIP administrative mode, and link state. Requires routing to be enabled on the interface.

syntax: show ip route [{ip-address [protocol] | {ip-address mask [longer-prefixes] [protocol] | protocol} [all] | all}]
summary: Displays the routing table and allows filtering by specific addresses, protocols, or all routes.
synopsis: The show ip route command presents the routing tables, showing each route's destination network, preference, metric, next-hop IP, last updated time, and outgoing interface. Options enable users to filter routes based on specific IP addresses, protocols, or to see the best and non-best routes.

summary: Reports all current ECMP groups in the IPv4 routing table.
synopsis: The show ip route ecmp-groups command lists all Equal-Cost Multi-Path (ECMP) groups, detailing the number of next hops and routes using those hops, along with each next hop's IPv4 address and outgoing interface.

summary: Displays routes not added to the hardware due to errors.
synopsis: This command shows routes that could not be inserted into the routing table in hardware because of hash errors or a full routing table condition.

summary: Displays routes from the kernel.
synopsis: This command shows routes that are known to the system's kernel, providing insight into the underlying routing structure independent of routing protocols.

summary: Displays net prototype routes.
synopsis: This command lists the net prototype routes defined in the routing table, helping understand specific routing configurations.

summary: Displays routing preferences for each type of route.
synopsis: This command reveals the preference values used for determining the best route among different types, where lower values are favored. It includes preferences for local, static, OSPF (intra and inter), external, and RIP routes.

summary: Displays a summary of routing table information including various types of routes.
synopsis: The command provides a concise overview of the routing table, listing counts for connected, static, RIP, and OSPF routes along with details on intra and inter area routes, external routes, and route statistics such as best and alternate routes.

syntax: show ip source binding [dhcp-snooping | static] [interface unit/slot/port] [vlan-id]
summary: Displays the IPSG bindings.
synopsis: This command shows the IPSG bindings, providing information about MAC addresses, IP addresses, entry types, VLANs, and related interfaces to verify DHCP Snooping configurations.

summary: Displays SSH settings.
synopsis: This command provides a detailed view of the current SSH configurations, including administrative modes, session counts, and timeout settings.

summary: Displays IP statistical information.
synopsis: This command provides statistical data related to IP operations, which adheres to standards defined in RFC 1213, serving to monitor and assess the IP layer's performance.

summary: Displays IP verification status on interfaces.
synopsis: This command shows the status of IP source verification on each interface, indicating whether or not IP source address validation is enforced.

summary: Displays the IPSG configurations on all ports.
synopsis: Use this command to show the IP Source Guard (IPSG) filtering configurations on interfaces, including Filter Type, IP Address, MAC Address, and VLAN information.

summary: Displays VLAN routing information for all VLANs with routing enabled.
synopsis: This command presents comprehensive VLAN routing details, showcasing the logical VLAN ID, associated interface, IP address, and subnet mask for each active routing VLAN.

summary: Displays VRRP functionality and global parameters.
synopsis: This command displays whether VRRP functionality is enabled or disabled on the switch. It also shows some global parameters required for monitoring, and it does not take any options.

syntax: show ip vrrp interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id} vrid
summary: Displays configuration and statistics for a specific VRRP router on an interface.
synopsis: This command displays all configuration information and VRRP router statistics of a virtual router configured on a specific interface. The parameter vrid is the virtual router ID ranging from 1 to 255, with the argument unit/slot/port indicating a physical routing interface or VLAN.

summary: Shows brief information about each configured virtual router.
synopsis: This command displays information about each virtual router configured on the switch. It takes no options and provides key details for each virtual router including its state and status.

syntax: show ip vrrp interface stats {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id} vrid
summary: Display statistics for virtual routers.
synopsis: This command shows statistical information about VRRP on the specified interface, including uptime, protocol, state transitions, and advertisements. The vrid (virtual router ID) and interface type must be specified.

summary: Displays summary information about configured IPv6 ACLs.
synopsis: The command 'show ipv6 access-lists [name]' provides an overview of all IPv6 ACLs on the switch. Specifying an ACL name gives detailed attributes including ICMP type, L4 port info, protocol filtering, and match status. The output varies based on the configured match criteria of the ACLs.

summary: Displays the IPv6 status of forwarding and routing modes.
synopsis: This command provides a concise overview of IPv6 configurations including forwarding mode, unicast routing mode, hop limits, and current rate limits for Errors and unresolved data.

summary: Displays the status of the DHCPv6 server.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the DHCPv6 server's operational status, including whether it is enabled or disabled, and the DUID if configured.

summary: Displays configured DHCP pool information.
synopsis: This command displays information about the configured DHCP pool. You can specify an IPv6 address to get the binding information for a specific DHCP client, including details such as DUID, IAID, and valid lifetimes.

syntax: show ipv6 dhcp interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id} [statistics]
summary: Displays DHCPv6 information for specified interfaces.
synopsis: This command shows DHCPv6 information for all relevant interfaces or a specific interface. The commanded unit/slot/port corresponds to a physical routing interface or VLAN routing interface. You can also display interface statistics if the optional statistics parameter is used.

summary: Displays configured DHCP pool details.
synopsis: This command shows details of a specific DHCP pool identified by its unique name configuration. It provides information about client DUIDs, prefixes, preferred and valid lifetimes, and DNS server addresses related to the pool.

summary: Displays DHCP snooping settings.
synopsis: This command shows the status and configuration of DHCP snooping, which helps prevent unauthorized DHCP servers on the network.

summary: Displays DHCP snooping binding entries.
synopsis: This command lists the DHCP snooping bindings, showing which IPv6 addresses have been assigned to specific MAC addresses under the snooping policy.

summary: Displays DHCP snooping database information.
synopsis: This command shows the contents of the DHCP snooping database, including binding information and the status of snooping.

summary: Displays DHCP snooping interface configurations.
synopsis: This command provides details on interfaces configured for DHCP snooping, including their operational status and any violations.

summary: List DHCP Snooping security violation statistics.
synopsis: This command provides statistical information regarding DHCP Snooping security violations across untrusted ports.

summary: Displays DHCPv6 statistics for all interfaces.
synopsis: This command outputs various statistics related to DHCPv6 transactions, including counts of solicits, requests, confirms, renews, releases, and other DHCPv6 messages processed by the server.

syntax: show ipv6 interface [brief | unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id | loopback number | tunnel number]
summary: Shows the usability status of IPv6 interfaces and ICMPv6 message settings.
synopsis: When invoked, this command displays details about IPv6 interfaces including their operational status, address assignments, administrative modes, and related configurations based on the parameters supplied.

summary: Shows usability status of IPv6 VLAN interfaces.
synopsis: Displays the operational details of specified VLAN ID for IPv6 interfaces, with an optional parameter to show IPv6 prefix information.

syntax: show ipv6 mld groups {unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id | group-address}
summary: Displays multicast group information reported by MLD.
synopsis: This command shows details about multicast groups reported by MLD, including interfaces, group addresses, and membership times, available only when MLD is enabled on at least one interface.

syntax: show ipv6 mld interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vland-id}
summary: Displays MLD-related information for interfaces.
synopsis: This command provides comprehensive information about MLD status, configuration, and associated parameters on the specified interface or VLAN.

summary: Display statistical information on MLD traffic.
synopsis: This command presents statistics related to MLD traffic, such as valid MLD packets received/sent, queries, reports, and malformed packets, helping in monitoring MLD operations.

summary: Displays a summary of the MLD-Proxy interface status parameters.
synopsis: This command provides an overview of the status for the host interface linked to MLD-Proxy, including admin and operational modes, MLD version, and multicast group statistics.

summary: Displays information about multicast groups reported by MLD-Proxy.
synopsis: This command provides details on multicast groups, including interface number, group address, last reporter, uptime, member state, filter mode, and number of sources.

summary: Displays detailed information about multicast groups reported by MLD-Proxy.
synopsis: Use this command to view details such as the interface, group address, last reporter, member state, filter mode, and sources attached to multicast groups reported by MLD-Proxy. This can help in troubleshooting and understanding multicast group behavior on the network.

summary: Displays detailed status parameters of the host interface with MLD-Proxy enabled.
synopsis: This command shows the host interface status parameters when MLD-Proxy is enabled, including MLD version and the number of queries and reports received and sent.

summary: Displays the mroute entries specific to IPv6.
synopsis: This command shows the current multicast route entries for IPv6, providing options for detailed or summary information including source and group IP addresses, protocol used, and interface details.

syntax: show ipv6 mroute group group-address {detail | summary}
summary: Displays multicast configuration settings for a specific IPv6 group.
synopsis: This command shows multicast configuration settings specific to IPv6, including flags, timer settings, incoming and outgoing interfaces, RPF neighboring routers, and expiration times of all entries in the multicast route table for the specified group IPv6 address.

syntax: show ipv6 mroute source source-address {detail | summary}
summary: Displays multicast configuration settings for a specific IPv6 source.
synopsis: This command provides the multicast configuration settings specific to IPv6 for the specified source IP address, including flags, timer settings, incoming and outgoing interfaces, RPF neighboring routers, and expiration times of all entries in the multicast route table for the defined source.

summary: Displays all configured IPv6 multicast static routes.
synopsis: Use the show ipv6 mroute static command in Privileged EXEC or User EXEC mode to display all the configured IPv6 multicast static routes. An optional source-address can be included to filter the output.

summary: Displays the status of the IPv6 RA guard host mode on the switch.
synopsis: This command provides information about which interfaces have IPv6 RA guard host mode enabled, along with their roles, allowing administrators to verify security configurations.

syntax: show ipv6 neighbor [interface {unit/slot/port | vlan vlan-id | tunnel number | ipv6-address}]
summary: Displays information about IPv6 neighbors.
synopsis: Utilize this command to view and assess the state of IPv6 neighbors based on the specified interface or address and obtain details about neighbor relationships.

summary: Displays information relevant to the OSPF router.
synopsis: This command outputs OSPF router status, including admin mode, external LSDB limits, and OSPF metrics. It provides insight into router capabilities, active areas, and the number of LSAs in the database.

summary: Displays information about OSPFv3 routes to Area Border Routers (ABR).
synopsis: This command takes no options and shows the internal OSPFv3 routes to reach Area Border Routers (ABR). Output includes the type of route, router ID, cost, area ID, next hop, and next hop interface.

summary: Displays information about a specified OSPF area.
